attributes.action: Pay Special Guardianship carers the same rate as foster carers.
attributes.background: We both work full time jobs but almost 50% of my partners annual salary goes on child care cost. We should not have to be financially punished for wanting to work or cover the cost in traveling to arrange visits with the natural birth parents.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/07/23/special-guardianship-orders-misused/

attributes.action: Freedom of movement for non-EU students during term time if no lectures missed
attributes.background: Overseas university students holding a Tiers 4 visa are technically not allowed to leave UK during term time even if they have no running modules, or they will take own risk at UK border. The university's authorised absence letter will never be approved except for emergency reason.

attributes.action: Reclassify forced entry or attempted entry into a home as an act of terrorism.
attributes.background: The distress and terror caused by someone trying to force their way into your home is a much more real and likely occurence than any threat from those acts currently classified as terrorist. These acts, however, cause real feelings of terror in the victims with a long lasting sense of insecurity.
attributes.additional_details:
From the perspective of the victim, there are far fewer resources available for the detection and apprehension of the perpetrators than there appears to be for the equivalent action against those currently considered as terrorists.
Witnessing someone attempting to force entry to your home, leave and then return with a weapon to use in the event that you confront them is a very real and terror inducing prospect for many people in this country.
It MUST be accorded the appropriate seriousness.

attributes.action: Ban homework in the UK
attributes.background: The children do plenty of work in school
attributes.additional_details: How are they supposed to eat, hang out with friends, do school clubs, bathe and get 8 hours of sleep when they have so much homework?

attributes.action: Reinstate pension age of 65 men 60 women for British citizens above 50 years old
attributes.background: Government greatly reduced the level of state pension paid with recent reform. This asks Government to reverse that decision for all people over the age of 50 years who have made a major contribution to their own state pension only to see it stolen away in the last years of their working lives.

attributes.action: Require that all single use drinks cups are 100% biodegradable.
attributes.background: Currently only around 1 in every 400 single use drinks cups, mainly used for takeaway coffee are recycled.  Many such cups end up littering our pavements, parks, beaches and rivers. It is time that all such cups should be 100% biodegradable to minimise their impact on the environment.

attributes.action: make all care/rest homes have a percentage of locally funded beds
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to lose all their money, sell their property to pay for their care when they have to go into a care/residential home? Then when the money runs out, they have to move on?
attributes.additional_details: Care homes/Residential homes charge an extorionate rate for the care they provide, ranging from £800 to £1000+ per week. Some places are locally funded, whilst others are privately funded, meaning the person living there has to pay full price, for the care they receive. Locally funded places, will take into account someones pension, and will only pay some of the cost,leaving the person very little "pocket money". But atleast they have some money! All care homes/Residential homes, should allow for the fact that someones money will run out eventually and should make provisions for this, allowing the elderly person to go over to locally funded monies, without moving them on,so the elderly person, will be secure in the place they live, to live outtheir final days.

attributes.action: Put FEMINISM WEEK on the National Curriculum: female role models in all subjects
attributes.background: As a fully qualified teacher I know first hand that some schools rarely teach about feminism at all. For just one week of the academic year, if we could teach not just the history of feminism, but celebrate the achievements of females today in every subject, we could inspire true equality in the U.K
attributes.additional_details:
Feminism is already on the rise: our education system should be at the forefront of the movement. Not just #heforshe and #equalpay trending on Twitter; but opening the minds of all students male, female and LGTBQ to believe in total equality for their generation, both at home and in the work place - so no matter what gender you are born, you can dream just as big, and command the same respect.

I am aware that teachers have to cover what is on the exams but one week will not interfere too much.

attributes.action: Help release Iranian prisoner of conscience kept in solitary confinement 6 years
attributes.background: I am a student of Mohammad Ali Taheri and I was arrested in Iran in a peaceful demonstration in protest to his death sentence (UN Special Reporter March 2016 report: https://goo.gl/WWhzjPTo ). I have been campaigning for him for several years and I need the UK government's help to free him.
attributes.additional_details:
** http://www.auswaertiges-amt.de/DE/Infoservice/Presse/Meldungen/2016/161108-MRHH-Mohammad_Ali_Taheri.html?version=2
 
** https://www.gruene-bundestag.de/presse/pressemitteilungen/2016/november/iran-freiheit-fuer-mohammad-ali-taheri-15-11-2016.html
 
** http://shaheedoniran.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/SG-Report-UNGA2016.pdf

**http://www.petertatchellfoundation.org/tag/dr-taheri/

**https://www.amnesty.org.uk/blogs/urgent-action-network/my-teacher-needs-your-urgent-help

attributes.action: Impose economic sanctions on the USA if they renege on the Paris Climate deal
attributes.background: Climate change is an immediate threat to global ecosystems, livelihoods and communities. The Paris climate agreement is international law and must be fulfilled in order to mitigate dangerous warming. We call for economic sanctions on the USA if they withdraw from the agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
Climate change will rapidly escalate within decades unless urgent action is taken. The USA contribute 16% of global CO2 emissions and must play a leading role in fulfilling the Paris agreement. If the USA withdraw this could lead to catastrophic consequences, with the poorest people in the world suffering the most. If they withdraw, the UK should impose economic sanctions on the USA and encourage its allies to do likewise. 
www.newscientist.com/article/2112164-president-trump-means-we-cant-escape-a-dangerously-warmer-world/ www.scientificamerican.com/article/trump-picks-top-climate-skeptic-to-lead-epa-transition 
www.independent.co.uk/news/science/climate-change-game-over-global-warming-climate-sensitivity-seven-degrees-a7407881.html

attributes.action: Ensure every UK home and business has access to a minimum of 2mb broadband.
attributes.background: All UK homes and businesses need access to a minimum 2mb broadband connection in order to benefit from the increasingly digital world. This should be universally completed, at no extra cost to customers, regardless of location and challenges, before any roll out of further improvements elsewhere.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must introduce legislation to make this a minimum standard for all internet providers to meet.

attributes.action: Stop all ivory trade from the UK and press for bans globally
attributes.background: Ivory collected after 1947 is currently illegal globally, however, Britain still exports legal Ivory to many countries such as Hong Kong, this  contributes greatly to the Ivory trade and can help salesmen conceal their illegal imports from across Africa, drastically harming elephant populations.

attributes.action: Create specialist knife crime units within the police.
attributes.background: In areas that have high levels of knife crime. Specialist knife crime units need to be created within the police, to tackle this ongoing issue.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/black-october-knife-crime-after-12086384.amp

attributes.action: Fund the NHS by increasing income-tax by 2 pence in the pound.
attributes.background: The NHS is on its knees, it requires reorganisation which means a lot more funding than is currently available from the Government purses.  We ALL benefit from the NHS and we CANNOT allow it to fall 'unfit for purpose'. "Once it has gone - there will be no turning back"
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS should be free service to all UK citizens and that is true in most cases however, 'nothing is free in life'. If we want to be able to visit a doctor when we feel ill or go to Casualty, when our child or other loved one has suffered a serious injury or perhaps receive cancer treatment or other medical care - maybe we need to call an ambulance in an emergency, we need to keep and fund the NHS.

To keep this service the NHS has to be paid for!!!

Working people could pay 2 pence in the pound  & those of us receiving State benefits & pensions to have 2% deducted at source.

 I want my grandchildren to be able to have access to a good NHS but we must all do our bit to pay for. 

Please sign this petition to help us achieve it.

attributes.action: Increase the number of years required to be eligible for UK citizenship
attributes.background: If refugees or persons with humanitarian protection can stay in the UK for 5 years and then be eligible for UK citizenship after 5 years, it discourages those from ever returning home once it is safe to do so.
attributes.additional_details: In Norway you have to wait 7 years, in Germany you have to wait 8 years, in Switzerland 10 years, and so on. I think there is a debate to be had about increasing the number of years to be eligible for UK citizenship.

attributes.action: Reduce TV License Fee for full time students living away from home.
attributes.background: Recent introduction of full TV license for students living away from home, even for iPlayer is nonsensical as it will be ignored, not paid and cannot be policed.  A more pragmatic approach would be to have a nominal fee (eg £10) where students can provide parental details of cover at home address.

attributes.action: Present a draft UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria.
attributes.background: UK to call on all civilised nations of the world (via the United Nations) to draft a UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria and would apply to ALL aircraft of Syria, Russia, and lran for the purposes of military operations until the complete and total cessation of hostilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3000,000 people have now lost their lives in this conflict. The UN has officially declared Aleppo as besieged. Russian and Syrian forces and their allies must not be allowed to continue to flout international law and bomb civilians, civilian infrastructure, hospitals and aid operations. Since the breakdown of the recent cease-fire on September 19 over 500 civilians have been killed in Aleppo alone, with at least 100 of those being children.
Sources: 
www.unicef.org
www.syriahr.com
and more

attributes.action: End disability discrimination through Essential Criteria for Driving Licences.
attributes.background: At present, there is no law preventing a role where the primary function is as a driver, or in the Emergency and Armed Services, to be distinct from a role requiring travel, both having an "Essential Criteria" for a "Full UK Driving licence", thus allowing for selective discrimination of disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Roles that require travel such as the following: 
https://roles.mariecurie.org.uk/VacancyInformation.aspx?VId=58439
are discriminating against disabilities whose condition affect their eligibility to drive.
While there are professions, that should be exempt, such as roles where the primary function is driving, or in Emergency and Armed Services roles, we ask parliament for roles outside these selected professions to apply to be able to list a "UK Driving Licence" as an "essential job criteria".

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to force pupils to sing religious songs
attributes.background: It is still legal to let a school punish students (through detentions ect...) for not singing religious songs when the songs doesn't apply to their religion or they're not religious at all... this outdated law should be removed
attributes.additional_details: The law states that religious and non religious schools must take part in some form of collective worship and that it must only be of christian character which isn't reflective of the demographic

attributes.action: Remove Chris Brown's ban from entering the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Due to the incident involving Rihanna in 2009, Chris Brown was banned from entering the United Kingdom as a result of his 5 year probation. 

Chris Brown was relieved of his probation last year and has not had a major run in with the police since.

He has the right to be allowed in the Uk.
attributes.additional_details:
May 27th 2014 - His daughter was born. Chris Brown has proven to be a good role model since the birth of his daughter. 

Chris Brown suffers from Bipolar Disorder and PTSD

attributes.action: Change to Western European time to take advantage of 1hr extra evening daylight
attributes.background: Conversion to Western European time would give one hour additional evening daylight throughout the year. Western France, much of Spain and all of Portugal are to the west of the UK and yet they are 1hr ahead. It would also have a business advantage of harmonising UK time with Western Europe.

attributes.action: Allow MOD personnel to cook meals within SLA using issued or personal appliances
attributes.background: Safety regulations have resulted in the banning of any cooking appliances other than microwave and toaster within SLA. This makes PAYD the only option on camps for eating a hot meal, allowing for monopoly by contractors. Personnel should be allowed the option of cooking their own meals if they wish.

attributes.action: Dissolve the House of Lords and replace it with a new appointment process
attributes.background: We are in a situation where the house of commons appears to not represent the working class people of Great Britain. It is seen by most working class people to be an extension of the House of Lords. We need a balance of wealthy people and poor people to correctly govern the UK.
attributes.additional_details: At present we have no balance, both houses are full of highly educated individuals most from privileged backgrounds.To restore balance we need a house to represent the not so fortunate of the UK i.e low paid workers, people who live in poorer areas,  people without an education, people without the chance to change their lives. I propose we dissolve the House of Lords and replace it with a cross section of society who are selected in much the same way we already make selections for Jury service.

attributes.action: Bring in a law to stop any more buildings over 30 floors being built in London.
attributes.background: London isn't Manhattan. Our original environment is dwarfed by mega-towers that no-one lives in. Let's ask the Government to bring in planning law to prevent any more towers over 30 floors being built in Central London. Those extra floors aren't solving any housing crisis - just overseas investors
attributes.additional_details:
Guardian article on 50 story St George's Wharf tower - the blight of Vauxhall riverside: 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/24/revealed-foreign-buyers-own-two-thirds-of-tower-st-george-wharf-london
This Ipsos mori survey for Skyline Campaign suggests that lots of people agree with me: 
http://workplaceinsight.net/majority-of-londoners-support-greater-restrictions-on-new-tall-buildings/

attributes.action: Reduce the full time working week to 35 hours, without lowering current salary.
attributes.background:
The UK Government needs to tackle the long-hours culture & promote a restructuring of working time (max 35 hours per week) and the way in which people work such as flexible working.

People who work more than 48 hours per week report more problems in terms of work & health than those who do not.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the 2011 Workplace Employment Relations Study (WERS), 41% of employees agreed or strongly agreed with the statement: ‘People in this workplace who want to progress usually have to put in long hours.’ 

According to the Fifth European Working Conditions Survey, people who work more than 48 hours per week report more problems in terms of work and health than those who do not.

attributes.action: Stop Sexual Harrassment in Schools
attributes.background:
A 2010 YouGov poll of 16-18 year olds found 29% of girls experienced unwanted sexual touching at school and a further 71% said they heard sexual name-calling towards girls at school daily or a few times per week.
We want it to be made law for schools to train teachers on how to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
Data published in September 2015 showed that 5,500 sexual offences were recorded in UK schools over a three year period, including 600 rapes. 
In 2015 Girlguiding UK found 90% of young women aged 13-21 agree that the government should make sure all schools are addressing sexual harassment and bullying in schools.

attributes.action: Educate society about Epilepsy and eradicate the stigma surrounding it
attributes.background: More than 500,000 people in the UK have epilepsy, which is a condition that affects the brain and causes repetitive seizures. There is a stigma around epilepsy that needs to be addressed, starting with the lack of knowledge the public have about what to do when someone has a seizure.
attributes.additional_details: Educating children from a young age in a First Aid class would severely decrease the stigma around epilepsy and therefore allow those with epilepsy to feel more accepted in the community. By placing a programme of First Aid in primary and secondary schools where children learn about what to do when witnessing a seizure- not touching the person or placing anything in their mouths etc- would make epilepsy a much less lonely and frightening condition.

attributes.action: Remove the Insurance Premium Tax
attributes.background: A tax known as IPT (Insurance Premium Tax) was added to all insurance policies by the last government and was originally levied at 6%. Recently this has risen to 9% and due to become 10% in October 2016.
attributes.additional_details: On a £500 insurance policy this adds a tax (for the privilege of taking out a policy, be it house insurance, car insurance, holiday insurance and pet insurance) of £50 to your Policy  and pro rata according to the amount you pay for your Policy. This is a statutory amount payable on EVERY policy you take out and so you are paying this tax on every Policy you have. You are not paying once, but a number of times. The IPT compulsory charge is making insurance policies unaffordable and is yet another `hidden` tax which is making us all poorer. Please sign the Petition to have IPT removed.

attributes.action: Increase funds and awareness of homeless shelters for young people on our street
attributes.background: Homeless Youth are far too often stereotyped as dangerous troublemakers. Change is needed, as homeless youth need to be noticed. We need to provide food, water and shelter. We need your help to raise awareness, and end homelessness in Youth for good. Help our cause. #itcouldbeme.
attributes.additional_details:
We are part of the Jackman Team, National Citizen Service (NCS) The Challenge, Wave 11, Croydon. Over the past week we have planned a campaign to help homeless Youth in our area on Friday 26th August 2016 in Croydon town centre.
Abuse, money loss, family bereavement are all causes of our new generation becoming homeless. Do we really want the future to be on our streets? Help our cause. Sign our petition. Together, we can end Youth homelessness for good.

attributes.action: Make inheritance tax applicable to all estates without exception.
attributes.background: It appears very rich people can avoid paying inheritance tax by using tax avoidance measures such as trusts. It would be fair if tax laws were simple and applied to everyone. If it is the law that inheritance tax is paid on estates above a certain value it must apply to everyone without exception.

attributes.action: Introduce motorcycle licence progression training as per the 3rd EU Directive.
attributes.background: Department of Transport ignored the licence progression training in Article 7.1.c of 3rd EU Driving Licence Directive. It imposed compulsory retesting which removed all incentive for novices to train and qualify for A1. There was an 8% increase in Killed & Seriously Injured 'after' implementation.
attributes.additional_details: 17-19 year olds can ride A1 class bikes (125cc) on a CBT cert. At 19 they can take the A2 test for larger bikes. There is now no incentive to train to A1 test standard because they are forced to repeat the same tests when they are entitled to progress at 19. This essentially entices them to wait and continue on a CBT. They ride for up to 2 years without any highway code knowledge, theory test and hazard perception. CBT only gives them 2 hours road preparation. DVSA stats show a 8% KSI increase.

attributes.action: Make GCSE Food Technology compulsory
attributes.background: Im a food lover and blogger and I want to make a change. I have loved food ever since I watched a Jamie Oliver christmas special back in 2006. My love for food and specifically helping younger people have grown over the years and now I want to kick up a fuss and make GCSE Food Technology compulsory
attributes.additional_details: The number of children taking Food Technology at GCSE is dropping. Too many kids nowadays are growing up not knowing how about food, with around 2 million children growing up with just one parent-it is questionable that mums and dads just don't have the time to teach their children how to cook/bake. The Department of Education quite clearly is TOO focused on wanting the children of the future to grow up to become more academic.

attributes.action: Reform of the UK's honours system, reflecting achievement, not money donated.
attributes.background:
The honours system has become discredited to the point that highest bidders win high honours, irrespective of their achievements and merit to the country.

Honours should only be given for real, tangible, honourable acts or achievements - not for political donations or doing a Whitehall job.
attributes.additional_details:
It seems incredulous that people are given knighthoods for doing Whitehall jobs they have been handsomely paid for anyway, yet doctors, nurses, consultants, teachers, firefighters, police etc all struggle to get recognition for saving lives and transforming society.

Handing honours to people who have helped individuals achieve office by money or political manoeuvring is sheer cronyism; the current system must now be overhauled to stop its dishonourable use and restore its proper status.

attributes.action: Change the upgrading process for motorcycle licenses.
attributes.background:
On 19th January 2013 the motorcycle licence restrictions changed for new motorcycle riders. 

This meant that in order to upgrade from an A2 motorcycle license to an A motorcycle license requires the rider to pass the exact same test that they passed two years prior on an arbitrarily smaller bike.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst the tiered licensing system has its merits, and rightfully deserves to stay, a rethink on the upgrading process for riders must be considered.

If the automatic upgrade that was in place before the 2013 update is not satisfactory, perhaps some type of competency test on a larger motorcycle could be implemented, to ensure the rider's skills are still satisfactory - an advanced version of the CBT for riders with existing qualifications who wish to advance through their licenses.

attributes.action: Relax the rules on appearance to allow service personnel to blend in more.
attributes.background: After recent attempted kidnapping of a serviceman I think it's time that the rules governing appearance and grooming should be permanently relaxed to allow serviceman appear to be a member of public.

attributes.action: Incentivise businesses to increase the number of Standing Desks for employees
attributes.background: Employees spend 40+ hours a week at their desks, the lack of movement is a key problem in the obesity pandemic. Introducing standing desks DRAMATICALLY reduces this and the chances of type II diabetes. Getting businesses to bring in standing desks will help make Britain healthier. We need guidelines
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the benefits of standing desks have been ratified by research conducted in the States and in Britain. According to the researchers 'Sitting is the new smoking'. 

Below are some articles which list the benefits:

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/five-health-benefits-standing-desks-180950259/?no-ist
https://authoritynutrition.com/7-benefits-of-a-standing-desk

attributes.action: Stop all Police cuts within the UK and increase high visibility patrols.
attributes.background: We need more police officers on the streets not police cuts

attributes.action: Put The Open Golf Championship back on free to air TV
attributes.background: This is the first time in 60 years The Open as not been broadcast on free to air TV. Signing the petition will help influence the government to make The Open Championship a group A protected listed sporting event. Live coverage of the event will then be offered to free to air broadcasters.
attributes.additional_details: The Open Championship dates back to 1860 and is the the world's most prestigious golf tournament and one of four golf majors. With the an international field of the world's best golfers competing for the top prize in golf. The coverage of The Open as been enjoyed by millions on the BBC for the last 60 years, inspiring viewers of all ages to go out and play golf. As a nation we should be proud to host this event and it should be celebrated as one of the great British sporting events.

attributes.action: Invest more funds into research, management & recovery of CFS/ME Chronic Fatigue
attributes.background: After being diagnosed with CFS/ME Chronic Fatigue Syndrome in 2013, I've struggled to get any ongoing support for my symptoms, management and recovery. There's simply not enough understood about the condition within the NHS or the general public. More research and media exposion is urgently needed!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.meassociation.org.uk

http://www.meassociation.org.uk/how-you-can-help/introduction-to-our-cbt-get-and-pacing-report/

http://www.meassociation.org.uk/research2015/cfsme-research-collaborative/

https://www.actionforme.org.uk

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53/ifp/chapter/Managing-CFSME

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53/evidence/full-guideline-196524109

attributes.action: To force all large retail outlets to buy British produce first at a fair price
attributes.background: With more and more produce available in the UK, why do we need to import 100's of tons of fruit and veg. I don't mind buying wonky carrots or odd shape veg, as long as it supports our farming/fishing industry. We need to support our own producers first.

attributes.action: Harsher punishments for people who discriminate.
attributes.background: Hate crime is on the rise. There was 4,345 cases of homophobic hate crime in 2011/12 and there was 5,597 cases in 2014/15. These criminals only get a fine or a short prison sentence for their crimes, this has to be changed.
attributes.additional_details: I know myself what it is like to be discriminated and disrespected, its an awful feeling and makes you question yourself and your existence.

attributes.action: Introduce better benefits for stay at home parents.
attributes.background: Child care is very expensive which means some parents decided to live off one wage and have a stay at home Mum or Dad for their child. I feel that there is not enough financial help from the government for stay at home parents.Sometimes the wage of one isn't enough.

attributes.action: Parliament make a full and unequivocal apology for UK's part in invading Iraq
attributes.background: There is a case for parliament to make a full unequivocal apology for going to war with USA on Iraqi, killing so many of their people and our soldiers following the outcome of Chilcot Inquiry. Be sceptical about Trident submarine replacement and other military things USA may try to pull UK into.
attributes.additional_details:
USA simply went to war with an aim of "bomb back to the stone age" countries with things they wanted. Senior US spokes persons have admitted that the motive for invasion was because Saddam was seeking to raise the price of oil. Parliament used a lie to disguise its reasons. It is time to be somewhat sceptical about what USA expects of UK. 

Now is time to apologies.

attributes.action: Force Airlines to offer nut free meals as an option.
attributes.background:
People with nut allergies can die of anaphylactic shock if they ingest nuts. Whilst it is possible to order Kosher, Muslim, Vegetarian, reduced salt etc etc meals. Not one airline will offer nut free meals as an option. 

It should be a legal requirement to make a nut free option available.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a list of the "Special Meal" options from British Airways:-

Type of meal

Lacto-ovo-vegetarian,
Vegan/vegetarian	
Asian/Hindu vegetarian
Muslim 
Kosher
Child meal	
Diabetic
Gluten intolerant	
Low calorie	
Low fat	
Low salt	
Low lactose

The above are meal choices. Yet someone who cannot eat nuts is not catered for. It is unreasonable for people on long haul flights particularly children to be denied safe food to eat.

attributes.action: Populate the Isle of Wight with Deer
attributes.background: Currently there are only a handful of deer on the Isle of Wight due to everytime any are spotted they are exterminated but I think that having deer on the island if controlled satisfactorily would be a good asset for the island.

attributes.action: Deliberate a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt the Health Secretary.
attributes.background: Following the demise of the NHS through lack of funding please deliberate a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt the Health Secretary to change the direction of the NHS and protect it for future generation's. Our lives depend on it!

attributes.action: Ban use of satellite navigation visual aids for black cab and private hire trade
attributes.background: Public safety should not be abused by allowing drivers of black cabs and private hire vehicles the elevated chance of being distracted and a danger to person or property whislt operating a vehicle and satellite navigation simultaneously whislt booked. Dont keep loved ones at risk with that booking.
attributes.additional_details: As stated on the gov.uk website under the policy paper regarding improving the driving test updated 25 August 2015, demonstrates there is evidence in the government's view to explore both the correlation between distrations, the causes of accidents and the need to perhaps introduce a baseline standard for drivers to demonstrate the ability to use satellite navigation safely. The general public in the interim of findings should be risk protected. Use of sat nav should be customer opt in only.

attributes.action: Stop the Brexit process and declare that Britain will remain in European Union.
attributes.background: In response to the referendum the government is spending a lot of money on preparing to take Britain out of the European Union. This petition calls on the government to immediately stop this process and to declare publicly that Britain will remain in the European Union.
attributes.additional_details: The referendum was unfair and undemocratic because millions of British citizens living abroad and at least a million citizens of countries in the EU resident of the UK were denied the vote. The great majority of these excluded people are in favour of the UK remaining in the EU and had they been allowed to vote, the result of the referendum would almost certainly have been to remain. I for example am a British citizen resident of Spain but was not allowed to vote so my voice to remain was ignored

attributes.action: Schools to allow pupils with excellent attendance, holidays during term time.
attributes.background: Taking a summer or winter holiday during half term or end of term, is incredibly expensive when you have children.  Holiday companies monopolise on parents like me every year, to the point where we sometimes just cannot afford to go away. I want the Government to consider a fair way to address this.
attributes.additional_details: Children with excellent attendance records should be able to take up to two weeks holiday per year (subject to the school agreeing the timings) to spend quality time away with their family.  I have a family of 5 and for us to camp in France in August will cost around £3,500 just for travel (by ferry) and accommodation (mobile home).  Nothing lavish, but very expensive when you throw in spending money too.  If we did this in May or June, it works out at £1200!  This seems so unfair for Parents.

attributes.action: Change the child tax credits from two children to four.
attributes.background: Lower income families and working families on low income need the extra help. Not many families have just two children and some people are now pregnant and at risk of miscarriage due to the stress of money worries.
